intro: Oxystophyllum buruense, commonly known as the Buru flame tree, is a tropical tree native to the island of Buru in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is known for its striking red and orange floral display, which occurs during the dry season. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it thrives in well-drained soils with ample sunlight. Oxystophyllum buruense plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
